page.title: 03LYNMOUTH COLLIERY
page.content: THE{SHAFTS}WERE SUNK BETWEEN 1927-1934 AND REBUILT DURING THE EIGHT YEARS OF 1949-1957 THE SHAFTS WERE DEEPNED AND THE{ROADWAYS}REBULT,THE AERIAL FLIGHT AND OLD WASHER WERE DEMOLISHED,AND THE NEW WASHER BUILT. COAL PRODUTION CEASED ONE NOVEMBER DUE TO AN {UNDERGROUND FIRE.}THE FIRE THE PIT WAS FLOODED.200,000000 GALLONS OF WATER WERE PUMPED IN TO PUT THE FIRE OUT.BORE HOLES WERE DRILLED TO ALLOW THE GAS TO ESCAPE.TWO MORE SHAFTS WERE SUNK NORTH OF{LYNMOUTH}ONE OF THEM, BEWICK DRIFT WAS DRIVEN TO A DEPTH OF 350 FEET.THE DRIFT WAS OPENED BY LORD ROBENS,N.C.B. CHAIRMAN.THE DAILY OUTPUT IS NOW 6000 TONS, 30,000 THE TONS A WEEK.
